title: Show full decimal precision for division results

requirements.summary: Display division results with up to 10 decimal places precision instead of truncating to 2 decimal places
acceptanceCriteria: 10 รท 3 displays as 3.3333333333 (10 decimal places) in the calculator result area.
Division results that are whole numbers (e.g., 10 รท 2 = 5) are displayed without unnecessary trailing zeros.
Division results with fewer than 10 significant decimal digits (e.g., 1 รท 4 = 0.25) are displayed exactly without padding zeros.
The fix applies to both the live preview display and the confirmed result display in CalculatorDisplay.tsx.
History entries saved to the backend also reflect the full precision value.
Other operations (addition, subtraction, multiplication, power, square root) are unaffected.

file_operations.description: Update the division result formatting in the evaluateExpression function to display up to 10 decimal places for division operations. Modify the division case in the switch statement to format results using toFixed(10) and then remove trailing zeros. Ensure whole number results display without decimal points and non-repeating decimals display their exact precision without padding.

Ensure the display component correctly renders the full precision division results passed from Calculator.tsx in both preview and confirmed states. Verify that the result formatting logic preserves the precision from the parent component without applying additional truncation.
